definition: celestial troops and generals (idiom)/fig. superior forces
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: None of the heavenly generals and soldiers could do anything about it.
sentences.chinese: 沒有任何天兵天將能夠阻止它。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor was enraged, and ordered the heavenly generals and their troops to arrest the four dragons.
sentences.chinese: 玉帝勃然大怒，而命令了天兵天將拘捕四龍。

definition: lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. to have three heads and six arms (idiom)/fig. to possess remarkable abilities/a being of formidable powers
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
altar lamp burning day and night
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
